revised_title: Comparative Development of Leishmania Strains in Chinese Sandflies
tldr: The author studied the development of various strains of Leishmania in Chinese sandflies, specifically Phlebotomus chinensis and P. mongolensis. They found that the Indian strain of Leishmania does not develop in these sandflies as readily as Chinese strains, with a significantly lower infection rate and different infection patterns. This suggests a biological distinction between the two strains.
